answers.answer: I'm 32 weeks pregnant I failed my first test ad well went back for the second and passed don't stress or worry about it as long as baby and you are healthy that's all that matters!♡ keep your head up!
I failed, came back a couple days later to do the three hour tests and was completely fine. Don't trip, it's probably nothing to worry about.

I had gestational diabetes with my first pregnancy and it wasn't so bad.  You just have to take good care of yourself and eat right.  Unfortunately I had to take insulin but the baby was born healthy and all was good..it's just a little more maintenance.  Don't worry either way you and baby will do just fine.
I failed my first test horribly. Haf to go bavk for anothrr and passed witj flying colors. Not sure why. Try not to stress ir self out. It will all be ok :)
I just recently failed my 1st test. Went back a week later for the 3 hr and passed. It had me stressed out for no reason. Most women I had talked to failed the 1st test too.
Ladies I failed both. I now have gestational diabetes! I'm high risk now! Mscrysmw, what should I eat until I see the nutritionist Monday????
Ladies I failed both. I now have gestational diabetes! I'm high risk now! Mscrysmw, what should I eat until I see the nutritionist Monday????

I failed my test. They put me on a diet and tell me to do at least 30 minutes walk a day. My baby was born on nov 7 and he is perfect. But they keeped checking his sugar st the hospital and it broke my heart. Thanks God all the test come back good. I was diagnosticed at 28 weeks. And they make me check my sugar 4 times a day. The nutriilogist will work with you to do a meal plan according to your schedule. Basically i had 3 meals a day what you need to watch is the carbohidrats i was allowed 45 to 60g of carbohidrats on each meal and i have two snacks between meals of 15g of carbs. The bigs NO. no soda just diet. NO juice any kind they have a lot of sugar. No cakes. The milk try to get the 2% or 1% if you need any info let me know i will be happy to talk :-)
I've declined the test in both previous pregnancies! My babies have both been perfectly fine. I plan to decline it again this time around. One less thing to make me worry!

Another big thing with gd is that you became a high risk pregnancy i had to have appoinyments each week so they check my sugar was ok and they also make me a sonogram each week to be sure baby is not growing too much. And the worst part once they diagnosticed you with gd you need to give birth before week 39 or you will get induced at week 39 because placenta starts to deteriorate after that week because your gd. It is a lot of work in taking care of your body and your little one inside there but it is worthled.
Thx so much! I do feel a lil better. I will keep in touch with you! Thx again! Also thx to the rest of u ladies. U have helped me a whole lot! I will let u guys know how things turn out!

question: Has anyone else failed! My nerves are very bad! Yesterday I failed and now I have to start going to the complications clinic! I just want to know my baby and I will be okay! Please pray for us! I'll be 30 wks tomorrow! This is my first pregnancy!
title: failed sugar test
